original_conversation.content: [shaky voice] They actually passed it. The vote was 287 to 146. I keep reading the numbers over and over because I can't— [pause] Twenty-three years. Twenty-three years of fighting for this. [crying while speaking] All those families who wrote to me, who shared their stories, who showed up at every single hearing even when it seemed hopeless. [sniffle] God, there were so many times I almost gave up. [laugh] Remember when Senator Morrison said we were wasting everyone's time? That this would never, ever happen? [very quietly] I actually believed him for a while. Almost quit the whole thing in 2019. But then I'd think about, um... I'd think about the Johnsons, and Maria's daughter, and all those kids who needed this. [relieved] Seven million people. That's how many people this affects. Seven million. [extremely happy] Their medical bills, their treatments, their entire lives are about to change! [pause] I should call Mom. She never stopped believing this would happen.
